options.text: "I just want what's best for my little Timmy; what parent wouldn't?" asks @@RANDOM_NAME1@@, who appears to have bribed your guards into getting an unscheduled meeting with you. "Growth hormone therapy is completely safe and the best doctor money could buy said it was a medically valid treatment for my little Timmy, what with him being [i]two whole inches[/i] below normal. Whether or not Timmy gets hormone therapy is between his doctor, my accountant, and me, not the government."
options.result: several inches are being added to first class seating

options.text: "Great!" sarcastically exclaims @@RANDOM_NAME1@@'s valet after @@HE@@ has walked out of the room. "One more way the rich get it better off than the poor. My kids are even shorter than his, but I could never afford this treatment. You have to level the playing field. State-employed doctors should determine who truly needs growth hormone therapy, and the state should pay for it." [[color=purple]Must not ban sports[/color]]
options.result: @@CAPITAL@@ Preparatory School for the Exceedingly Wealthy's basketball team is having a few off-years

options.result: posh kids don't look down on the poor any more

options.text: "This is insane," cries a voice whose origins you can't locate at first, until you look down and find the wee Dr. Bill Harford. "There's nothing wrong with being shorter than average, even way shorter than average. You can't call something a 'treatment' if there are no adverse health effects associated with the 'illness' it treats. Ban growth hormone therapy in all cases and teach @@DEMONYM_PLURAL@@ to love each other no matter what their size."
options.result: diminutive @@DEMONYMADJECTIVE@@ generals are feared for their aggressiveness

policiesAndNotabilities.full: sometimes adds notability: punitive income tax rates

options.text: "I agree that the government should assure no one feels inferior because of the hand nature dealt to them," asserts everyman Berger Harrison, who is so average as to be completely unidentifiable. "However, what we should be doing is manipulating the hormones of all children so that they all end up at exactly the same height. All men may not be created equal, but we can fix that."
options.result: people are always able to look each other in the eye
